creator: Srinjita
title: Makey Makey- Storyboard
description: This project describes how to build a storyboard with different 3D printed puzzle pieces. Each piece is uniquely identified by a different resistor. When a piece is placed on the board, it completes a voltage divider circuit that is recognized by the MakeyMakey. This allows for a story telling platform that fills in words of a story/poem based on where a piece is placed on the board.
steps: Build six different puzzle pieces with pictures on them, modeling them to hold two magnets and a resistor. 3D print these pieces.
Design and create a board that can hold the magnets and the voltage divider circuit. Files are provided for reference.
Build the voltage divider circuit on the board using six 1 kilo Ohm resistors and 12 magnets. Connect one end of each resistor to ground and the other end to an AnalogPin of the MakeyMakey board.

Connect the wires to the MakeyMakey board, plugging the ground wire into the GND pin and the other ends of the resistors to Analog pins A0-A5. Establish a connection from the MakeyMakey board to the voltage divider frame.
Add a different resistor (470, 680, 1000, 2200, 3300, and 4700 Ohm) to each of the puzzle pieces, placing them inside the gap and adding two magnets on either side.
Reprogram the MakeyMakey board using the provided code.

Connect the MakeyMakey to a computer using a USB cable and use the MakeyMakey Storyboard website. Place puzzle pieces on the Storyboard frame to hear the website read it off and see the text change. Select 'Read Story' to have the website read the entire story.
